title: Boiled Shrimp With Rémoulade Sauce and Spicy Cocktail Sauce
summary: Need a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian main course? Boiled Shrimp With Rémoulade Sauce and Spicy Cocktail Sauce could be a great recipe to try. This recipe serves 25. For $2.22 per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 22g of protein, 2g of fat, and a total of 115 calories. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 42 minutes. If you have shrimp, spicy cocktail sauce, water, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the lemons you could follow this main course with the Blackberry Lemon Chess Pie w/ Honey Jumbleberry Sauce. How I won the SF Food Wars – Pie or Die Competition as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 41%. This score is pretty good. Try Shrimp Cocktail Bar: Classic Cocktail Sauce, Avocado Crema, Remoulade, Boiled Shrimp with Tangy Cocktail Sauce, and Roasted Shrimp Cocktail with Spicy Sriracha Cocktail Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 23 dollars.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity – making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.

instructions: Bring first 3 ingredients to a boil in a large stockpot. Add shrimp, and cook 2 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink; drain and rinse with cold water.                                                                                                 Peel shrimp, and devein, if desired. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with Rmoulade Sauce and Spicy Cocktail Sauce.

steps.step: Bring first 3 ingredients to a boil in a large stockpot.
Add shrimp, and cook 2 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink; drain and rinse with cold water.
Peel shrimp, and devein, if desired. Chill until ready to serve.
Serve with Rmoulade Sauce and Spicy Cocktail Sauce.
